Enchantment

An Enchantment is a special magical property that can be added to weapons in Remixed Dungeon using an Arcane Stylus. Each weapon can have only one enchantment, which provides special offensive or utility abilities.

Common Enchantments

  • Blazing: Deals fire damage to enemies
  • Blooming: Causes grass to grow around the target
  • Chilling: Slows enemies with cold damage
  • Dazzling: Blinds enemies when they are attacked
  • Electro: Deals lightning damage to nearby enemies
  • Holy: Deals bonus damage to undead and demons
  • Impassable: Pushes enemies back when attacking
  • Kinetic: Stores excess damage for the next hit
  • Leech: Heals you when you hit enemies
  • Luck: Increases damage with a chance to deal extra damage
  • Projecting: Increases weapon reach
  • Shocking: Deals electricity damage to nearby enemies

Application

  • Applied using a Scroll of Weapon Upgrade on weapons
  • Process is random - you don't choose which enchantment is applied
  • Once applied, the enchantment cannot be removed or changed
  • Higher-level weapons will have stronger enchantment effects
  • Unlike regular Scroll of Upgrade, this specialized version will never destroy existing enchantments
  • For unenchanted weapons, it adds a random enchantment; for already-enchanted weapons, it preserves the existing enchantment while improving the weapon's upgrade level

Code Reference

  • Java Class: ScrollOfWeaponUpgrade.java
  • Source Code Location: RemixedDungeon/src/main/java/com/watabou/pixeldungeon/items/scrolls/ScrollOfWeaponUpgrade.java
  • The upgrade method in the weapon class handles both upgrade level improvement and enchantment preservation

Strategic Considerations

  • Choose weapons to enchant based on your needs and playstyle
  • Consider class synergies (e.g., Warriors benefit from damage enchantments)
  • Some enchantments are more valuable than others depending on the dungeon level
  • Risk vs. reward: you might get a highly desirable enchantment or an unhelpful one
